performance.title: Use efficient cache lifetimes
performance.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more about caching](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/cache).

performance.title: Font display
performance.description: Consider setting [font-display](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/font-display) to swap or optional to ensure text is consistently visible. swap can be further optimized to mitigate layout shifts with [font metric overrides](https://developer.chrome.com/blog/font-fallbacks).

performance.title: Improve image delivery
performance.description: Reducing the download time of images can improve the perceived load time of the page and LCP. [Learn more about optimizing image size](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/image-delivery)

performance.title: LCP request discovery
performance.description: [Optimize LCP](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/lcp-discovery) by making the LCP image discoverable from the HTML immediately, and avoiding lazy-loading

performance.title: Network dependency tree
performance.description: [Avoid chaining critical requests](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/network-dependency-tree) by reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load.

performance.title: Minify JavaScript
performance.description: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time. [Learn how to minify JavaScript](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/performance/unminified-javascript/).

performance.title: Reduce unused CSS
performance.description: Reduce unused rules from stylesheets and defer CSS not used for above-the-fold content to decrease bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn how to reduce unused CSS](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/performance/unused-css-rules/).

performance.title: Reduce unused JavaScript
performance.description: Reduce unused JavaScript and defer loading scripts until they are required to decrease bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn how to reduce unused JavaScript](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/performance/unused-javascript/).

performance.title: Largest Contentful Paint
performance.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn more about the Largest Contentful Paint metric](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/performance/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

performance.title: Speed Index
performance.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more about the Speed Index metric](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/performance/speed-index/).

performance.title: Layout shift culprits
performance.description: Layout shifts occur when elements move absent any user interaction. [Investigate the causes of layout shifts](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/cls-culprit), such as elements being added, removed, or their fonts changing as the page loads.

performance.title: Optimize DOM size
performance.description: A large DOM can increase the duration of style calculations and layout reflows, impacting page responsiveness. A large DOM will also increase memory usage. [Learn how to avoid an excessive DOM size](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/dom-size).

performance.title: LCP breakdown
performance.description: Each [subpart has specific improvement strategies](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/lcp-breakdown). Ideally, most of the LCP time should be spent on loading the resources, not within delays.

performance.title: Render blocking requests
performance.description: Requests are blocking the page's initial render, which may delay LCP. [Deferring or inlining](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/performance/insights/render-blocking) can move these network requests out of the critical path.

performance.title: Time to Interactive
performance.description: Time to Interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more about the Time to Interactive metric](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/performance/interactive/).

performance.title: Max Potential First Input Delay
performance.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more about the Maximum Potential First Input Delay metric](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/performance/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

performance.title: Minify CSS
performance.description: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes. [Learn how to minify CSS](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/performance/unminified-css/).

performance.title: Avoid long main-thread tasks
performance.description: Lists the longest tasks on the main thread, useful for identifying worst contributors to input delay. [Learn how to avoid long main-thread tasks](https://web.dev/articles/optimize-long-tasks)

performance.title: Network Requests
performance.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

performance.title: Network Round Trip Times
performance.description: Network round trip times (RTT) have a large impact on performance. If the RTT to an origin is high, it's an indication that servers closer to the user could improve performance. [Learn more about the Round Trip Time](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-latency-and-bandwidth/).

performance.title: Server Backend Latencies
performance.description: Server latencies can impact web performance. If the server latency of an origin is high, it's an indication the server is overloaded or has poor backend performance. [Learn more about server response time](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-web-performance/#analyzing-the-resource-waterfall).

performance.title: Tasks
performance.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

performance.title: Diagnostics
performance.description: Collection of useful page vitals.

performance.title: Metrics
performance.description: Collects all available metrics.

performance.title: Screenshot Thumbnails
performance.description: This is what the load of your site looked like.

performance.title: Final Screenshot
performance.description: The last screenshot captured of the pageload.

performance.title: Script Treemap Data
performance.description: Used for treemap app

performance.title: Resources Summary
performance.description: Aggregates all network requests and groups them by type

performance.title: Avoid large layout shifts
performance.description: These are the largest layout shifts observed on the page. Each table item represents a single layout shift, and shows the element that shifted the most. Below each item are possible root causes that led to the layout shift. Some of these layout shifts may not be included in the CLS metric value due to [windowing](https://web.dev/articles/cls#what_is_cls). [Learn how to improve CLS](https://web.dev/articles/optimize-cls)

accessibility.title: `[user-scalable="no"]` is used in the `<meta name="viewport">` element or the `[maximum-scale]` attribute is less than 5.
accessibility.description: Disabling zooming is problematic for users with low vision who rely on screen magnification to properly see the contents of a web page. [Learn more about the viewport meta tag](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/meta-viewport).

accessibility.title: Elements use prohibited ARIA attributes
accessibility.description: Using ARIA attributes in roles where they are prohibited can mean that important information is not communicated to users of assistive technologies. [Learn more about prohibited ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/aria-prohibited-attr).

accessibility.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
accessibility.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/color-contrast).

accessibility.title: Lists do not contain only `<li>` elements and script supporting elements (`<script>` and `<template>`).
accessibility.description: Screen readers have a specific way of announcing lists. Ensuring proper list structure aids screen reader output. [Learn more about proper list structure](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/list).

accessibility.title: List items (`<li>`) are not contained within `<ul>`, `<ol>` or `<menu>` parent elements.
accessibility.description: Screen readers require list items (`<li>`) to be contained within a parent `<ul>`, `<ol>` or `<menu>` to be announced properly. [Learn more about proper list structure](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/listitem).

accessibility.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
accessibility.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/target-size).

accessibility.title: Elements with visible text labels do not have matching accessible names.
accessibility.description: Visible text labels that do not match the accessible name can result in a confusing experience for screen reader users. [Learn more about accessible names](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/label-content-name-mismatch).

accessibility.title: Uses ARIA roles only on compatible elements
accessibility.description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/aria-allowed-role).

bestPractices.title: Ensure CSP is effective against XSS attacks
bestPractices.description: A strong Content Security Policy (CSP) significantly reduces the risk of cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. [Learn how to use a CSP to prevent XSS](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/best-practices/csp-xss/)

bestPractices.title: Use a strong HSTS policy
bestPractices.description: Deployment of the HSTS header significantly reduces the risk of downgrading HTTP connections and eavesdropping attacks. A rollout in stages, starting with a low max-age is recommended. [Learn more about using a strong HSTS policy.](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/best-practices/has-hsts)

bestPractices.title: Ensure proper origin isolation with COOP
bestPractices.description: The Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy (COOP) can be used to isolate the top-level window from other documents such as pop-ups. [Learn more about deploying the COOP header.](https://web.dev/articles/why-coop-coep#coop)

bestPractices.title: Mitigate DOM-based XSS with Trusted Types
bestPractices.description: The `require-trusted-types-for` directive in the `Content-Security-Policy` (CSP) header instructs user agents to control the data passed to DOM XSS sink functions. [Learn more about mitigating DOM-based XSS with Trusted Types](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/best-practices/trusted-types-xss).

bestPractices.title: Detected JavaScript libraries
bestPractices.description: All front-end JavaScript libraries detected on the page. [Learn more about this JavaScript library detection diagnostic audit](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/best-practices/js-libraries/).

seo.title: Document does not have a meta description
seo.description: Meta descriptions may be included in search results to concisely summarize page content. [Learn more about the meta description](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/seo/meta-description/).

seo.title: robots.txt is not valid
seo.description: If your robots.txt file is malformed, crawlers may not be able to understand how you want your website to be crawled or indexed. [Learn more about robots.txt](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/seo/invalid-robots-txt/).
